bleeding.title: Heavy Bleeding
steps: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth
Keep the injured area elevated above heart level if possible
DO NOT remove the cloth if blood soaks through - add more layers
Call ambulance immediately if bleeding doesn't stop in 10 minutes
Keep the person calm and lying down
bleeding.warning: Seek immediate medical help for severe bleeding

breathing.title: Difficulty Breathing
steps: Help the person sit upright - do not lay them flat
Loosen any tight clothing around neck and chest
Open windows for fresh air circulation
If they have an inhaler, help them use it
Call ambulance if condition worsens
breathing.warning: Call 102 immediately if lips turn blue

unconscious.title: Person Unconscious
steps: Check if the person is breathing
If breathing, place in recovery position (on their side)
If NOT breathing, start CPR if trained
Call ambulance immediately
Do NOT give food or water to unconscious person
unconscious.warning: Never leave an unconscious person alone

pregnancy.title: Pregnancy Emergency
steps: Keep the woman calm and comfortable
If bleeding, have her lie on her left side
Note the time contractions start and their frequency
Do NOT give any medication without medical advice
Call ambulance or go to nearest hospital immediately
pregnancy.warning: Any vaginal bleeding or severe pain needs immediate attention

seizure.title: Seizure / Fits
steps: Clear the area of hard or sharp objects
DO NOT hold the person down or put anything in their mouth
Turn them on their side after seizure stops
Time the seizure - if over 5 minutes, call ambulance
Stay with them until fully recovered
seizure.warning: Call ambulance if this is their first seizure

burn.title: Burns
steps: Cool the burn under running water for at least 20 minutes
Remove jewelry or tight items near the burn
Cover loosely with a clean, dry bandage
DO NOT apply ice, butter, or toothpaste
Seek medical help for large or deep burns
burn.warning: Face, hands, or genital burns need immediate medical care
